definition: variant of 開國元勳|开国元勋, founding figure (of country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company, school etc
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon

sentences.english: If Rexroth was the founding father, Madeline Gleason was the founding mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果力士乐是开国元勋，麦德兰格里森是创始母亲。

sentences.english: Our founders believed in universal values.
sentences.chinese: 美国的开国元勋们相信共同价值。

definition: outstanding founding minister (title given to reward loyal general or vassal of new dynasty or state)
to found a state/to open a closed country
leading light/founding father/principal proponent/also written 元勳|元勋
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
to have reached the highest official positions
